author: Henning Bräuninger
title: Weggefährte blickt pessimistisch auf Michael Schumachers Zustand
text:
Weggefährte blickt pessimistisch auf Michael Schumachers Zustand
Seit Michael Schumachers Ski-Unfall bleibt sein Gesundheitszustand ein streng gehütetes Geheimnis. Ein alter Weggefährte teilt jetzt seine Besorgnis mit.
München – Am 29. Dezember 2013 veränderte sich das Leben von Michael Schumacher und seiner Familie schlagartig. Bei einem Skiunfall in den französischen Alpen zog sich der siebenmalige Formel-1-Weltmeister schwere Kopfverletzungen zu. Seitdem ist die Öffentlichkeit im Unklaren über seinen tatsächlichen Gesundheitszustand. Richard Hopkins, ein früherer Weggefährte aus der Formel 1, Ex-Red-Bull-Boss und Kaffee-Buddy der Rennsport-Legende, hat nun in einem Interview mit der englischen Sun seine Sorgen geteilt.
Schumacher-Weggefährte sorgt sich um die Formel-1-Legende
Hopkins erinnert sich an Schumacher und beteuert, er sei ein „großartiger Typ“ gewesen, ein „außergewöhnlicher Charakter“. Um so schwerer fällt es ihm, mit der Unwissenheit umzugehen: „Ich verstehe, dass sein Gesundheitszustand eine sehr private Sache ist. Aber ich wünschte, wir alle wüssten mehr“, gesteht Hopkins, doch „der Kreis um Michael Schumacher ist sehr klein“.
Hopkins gehört selbst nicht zu diesem engen Kreis, der eingeweiht ist oder ihn sogar besuchen darf. Er erklärt, dass seine Sorgen um Schumacher immer größer würden, desto mehr Zeit vergeht. „Die Gefahr ist, dass wir alle Vermutungen anstellen und dass diese Vermutungen sogar schlimmer sind als die Realität“, so Hopkins.
Wenn Helm-Unterschriften zum Mutmaßungen verleiten
Spekulationen über den Gesundheitszustand des 56-Jährigen gibt es in der Tat immer wieder. Basis für diese Vermutungen sind jedoch häufig kleinste Details, wie beispielsweise Schumachers Unterschrift auf einem Helm für eine Charity-Aktion. „Wir würden alle liebend gerne glauben, dass er den Stift aus der Schublade gezogen hat und ihn unterschrieben hat, aber wahrscheinlich gab es auf dem Weg dorthin etwas Unterstützung“, so Hopkins.
Eine Frage wird er sich wohl nie beantworten können: „Wenn er heute bei einem Rennen dabei sein könnte, frage ich mich, würde er das wohl tun? Ich frage mich, ob er es heute lieben würde, auf einer Rennstrecke aufzukreuzen, jeder würde es lieben, wenn er dort wäre“, rätselt Hopkins, fügt dann aber hinzu, dass der nicht glaubt, „dass er das tun würde. Ich glaube, er würde mehr Zeit mit anderen Interessen verbringen, mehr Zeit mit einem verdammten Pferd als mit der Rennbahn!“ Wir werden es höchstwahrscheinlich nie erfahren. (hbr)

author: 小浪财讯
title: 卫星ETF（159206）跌1.43%，半日成交额301.24万元|卫星_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，卫星ETF（159206）跌1.43%，报0.962元，成交额301.24万元。卫星ETF（159206）重仓股方面， 中国电信 截止午盘跌0.77%， 中兴通讯 跌0.57%， 中际旭创 涨3.03%， 新易盛 涨0.13%， 中国卫星 跌2.04%， 国盾量子 跌2.75%， 复旦微电 涨1.35%， 上海瀚讯 跌3.11%， 电科芯片 跌1.58%， 华力创通 跌3.14%。
卫星ETF（159206）业绩比较基准为 国证商用卫星通信产业指数 收益率，管理人为永赢基金管理有限公司，基金经理为刘庭宇，成立（2025-03-06）以来回报为-2.43%，近一个月回报为5.70%。

author: @Anti_AgingNews
title: Daily Step Count May Be Important To Preventing Alzheimer’s Disease | Worldhealth.net Anti-Aging News
text: [Exercise](/list/exercise/) [Alzheimer's Disease](/list/alzheimers_disease/) [Anti-Aging Tip Sheets](/list/anti-aging-tip-sheets/) [Behavior](/list/behavior/) Daily Step Count May Be Important To Preventing Alzheimer’s Disease4 weeks, 1 day ago 2042 0 Posted on Dec 28, 2023, 7 p.m. An [international study](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38073389/) published in the Journal of Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) that included a team from the Pacific Neuroscience Institute’s Brain Health Center at Providence Saint John’s Health Center has revealed a link between regular exercise and better brain health; showing that being physically active is related to the increased size of brain areas that are important for learning and memory. This study involved analyzing the MRI brain scans from 10,125 people and found that those who regularly engaged in physical activity like sports, walking, or running had larger brain volumes in key regions/areas. The key areas included gray matter which helps with processing information, white matter which connects different brain regions, and the hippocampus which is important for memory, among other areas. This study builds upon [previous work](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26967227/) from this group that linked caloric burn from leisure activities to improved brain structure and another [Lancet Study](https://www.thelancet.com/article/S0140-6736(20)30367-6/fulltext) that was published in 2020 that identified around a dozen modifiable risk factors that increase the risk for AD. Findings from this current study highlight a simple way to keep our brains healthy: stay active. You don’t need fancy equipment or a gym membership to be active, you just need to get up and move. This could be taking a daily walk, dancing, playing your favorite sport, or riding a bike. Whatever you choose, engaging in regular physical activity can have lasting beneficial effects on brain health that make the effort well worth it. "Our research supports earlier studies that show being physically active is good for your brain. Exercise not only lowers the risk of dementia but also helps in maintaining brain size, which is crucial as we age,” said [Cyrus A. Raji, M.D.](https://www.mir.wustl.edu/employees/cyrus-raji/), who is the lead researcher. "We found that even moderate levels of physical activity, such as taking fewer than 4,000 steps a day, can have a positive effect on brain health. This is much less than the often-suggested 10,000 steps, making it a more achievable goal for many people,” noted [David Merrill, M.D.](https://www.providence.org/doctors/psychiatry/ca/santa-monica/david-merrill-1902923410), who is the study co-author and director of the PBHC. “Our research links regular physical activity to larger brain volumes, suggesting neuroprotective benefits. This large sample study furthers our understanding of lifestyle factors in brain health and dementia prevention,” said study co-author [Somayeh Meysami, M.D.](https://www.saintjohnscancer.org/about-us/people/somayeh-meysami-md/), assistant professor of neurosciences at Saint John’s Cancer Institute and the Pacific Brain Health Center. "This study demonstrates the influence of exercise on brain health imaging and when added to other studies on the role of diet, stress reduction and social connection offer the proven benefits of drug-free modifiable factors in substantially reducing Alzheimer's disease," said George Perry, Editor-in-Chief of Journal of Alzheimer's Disease. As with anything you read on the internet, this article should not be construed as medical advice; please talk to your doctor or primary care provider before changing your wellness routine. This article is not intended to provide a medical diagnosis, recommendation, treatment, or endorsement. These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. Content may be edited for style and length. References/Sources/Materials provided by: T.W. at WHN [https://www.iospress.com/news/new-study-shows-exercise-can-boost-brain-health](https://www.iospress.com/news/new-study-shows-exercise-can-boost-brain-health) [https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38073389/](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38073389/) [https://content.iospress.com/articles/journal-of-alzheimers-disease/jad230740](https://content.iospress.com/articles/journal-of-alzheimers-disease/jad230740) [https://www.thelancet.com/article/S0140-6736(20)30367-6/fulltext](https://www.thelancet.com/article/S0140-6736(20)30367-6/fulltext)

organizations.name: pacific neuroscience institute’s brain health center

author: Joe Rubino
title: Denver warming shelters open 24 hours a day during arctic blast
text:
The city of Denver will keep its cold weather shelters open 24 hours a day over the long holiday weekend to protect people from dangerous conditions amid a blast of arctic air that is expected to grip the eastern part of the state through Tuesday.
The city’s announcement comes after Gov. Jared Polis issued a disaster declaration on Thursday mobilizing the Colorado National Guard to assist communities with keeping their residents safe.
The state is keeping a running list of shelters and other warming center resources available on its Department of Homeland Security and Emergency Management website at dhsem.colorado.gov .
“No one should freeze to death in our state for lack of shelter,” Polis said in a statement Thursday.
The National Weather Service has issued a wind chill warning for the metro area and other eastern Colorado counties starting Friday night and stretching into Tuesday. In Denver, that warning will coincide with chances of snow starting Friday evening and running through Monday night.
Windchill could drop as low as -20 degrees in the city over the weekend. Across the eastern half of the state, some areas could see windchill as low as -35 degrees, according to the Weather Service.
“Frostbite and hypothermia will be possible for anyone exposed to the elements,” Weather Service officials said in a hazardous weather advisory. “It is important to dress appropriately with multiple layers of clothing, hat, and mittens if you do venture out.”
For Denver, the blast of dangerous cold comes as Mayor Mike Johnston’s administration has filled converted hotels and other forms of shelter with people who are homeless and migrants who have arrived in the city from the southern border in recent months. Now some of those hotels will be part of an emergency cold weather response as well.
People seeking shelter in Denver are urged to go to the city’s “front door” access points to receive help. For single men, that is the Lawrence Street Community Center at 2222 Lawrence St. For women, that is the Samaritan House at 2301 Lawrence St. And for young people between the ages of 15 and 20 years old, that is Urban Peak at 2100 Stout St., according to the city.
Families in need should call the city’s Connection Center at 303-295-3366, city spokeswoman Derek Woodbury said.
The city’s emergency warming shelters at a former DoubleTree Hotel at 4040 Quebec St. and a former Best Western Hotel at 4595 Quebec St. will open at 7 p.m. Friday and remain open until at least 10 a.m. Tuesday, according to the city’s update.
Related Articles Colorado News | Arctic cold blast sets in Friday, with wind chills of -30 degrees possible through Tuesday Colorado News | More than 600 flights delayed, canceled at Denver International Airport Colorado News | Denver City Council poised to limit camping ban enforcement in freezing weather Daytime warming space will be available at all open city recreation centers during their regular business hours over the weekend. Libraries will also serve that purpose, according to Friday’s announcement.
All city offices and facilities are scheduled to be closed Monday for the Martin Luther King Jr. Day holiday, but the Glenarm Recreation Center at 2800 Glenarm Place will be open from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. specifically as a warming shelter, city officials said.
The city may extend emergency resources on Tuesday depending on the weather conditions. More information is available at denvergov.org/findshelter .
The Denver City Council on Tuesday night is scheduled to vote on a bill that would ban Denver police and other agencies from taking away a homeless person’s tent or other shelter if temperatures are at or below 32 degrees.
Get more Colorado news by signing up for our daily Your Morning Dozen email newsletter.

author: Alessandra Carneiro
title: Tiny Township residents fighting to stop new municipal building plans supported by Green Party leader | CTV News
text:
Karen Zulynik and her neighbours refuse to give up their fight to stop the town's plans for a new administration building.
“I don't know if they’re surprised but the people are empowering me to continue on to be their voice,” Karen Zulynik, Tiny Township resident.
Zulynik has led a campaign to stop the $25.6 million build.
She led a protest in July with hundreds in attendance, and a petition calling for a referendum garnered more than 7,000 signatures.
“The enthusiasm is only getting larger, we don’t feel defeated at all - we feel more united and that’s the most powerful thing is giving people information,” Zulynik.
The situation caught the attention of Ontario Green Party Leader Mike Shreiner, who tabled a petition at Queen’s Park on Tuesday requesting a referendum on the town's new administrative building.
“On behalf of the residents of Tiny Township who are bringing forward concerns about the financial environmental cost of a local administrative building. They sound like their voices are not being heard, and I wanted to make sure their voices were heard in the legislature,” said Shreiner.
Download the CTV News app free to get local news alerts Don't miss breaking news - Sign up for the CTV Newsletter Currently, the town's staff operate under different roofs, many in aging facilities that need urgent attention, according to the mayor. The Town wants to create one centralized administrative building that would include council chambers.
Tiny Township Mayor David Evans is adamant that he wants the project to move forward. He met with residents on Thursday asking them to remove signage reading 'Stop the Build' to be removed from the town's property.
“As far as the minister involving themselves in the affairs of the municipality, I'm a little disappointed and frustrated. First of all, MPPs, members of provincial parliament, should respect municipal autonomy. We are a vessel of the provincial government. But just like we don't tell them what to do, they shouldn't be telling us what to do,” said Evans.
The province is expected to respond to residents who started the petition by the end of November or early December, and that’s when they will find out more about potential further conversations.

author: Penrose
title: #77 Acuchillado y herido un político ultraderechista en otro ataque en Mannheim
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#14](c14#c-14) es una agresion uno y lo otro también, encima con amenazas de por medio según el agredido .
Aquí al menos los agresores van a acabar ante la justicia.
[#21](c21#c-21) Es evidente que para algunos es lo mismo un agresor que le da dos hostias a otro, que un puto asesino que la emprende a cuchilladas con seis personas.
Que sí, que ambas son agresiones, pero en una te juegas dos hostias y en otra la vida.
[#35](c35#c-35) Amenazas se llama, punible legalmente y execrable por supuesto, pero que son con mucho menos graves que machetear a seis personas.
Y comparar estos dos hechos es un manipulación de libro también, como pretendéis hacer algunos con vuestros comentarios. Las cosas claras, eso digo.
Lo "mismito" una cosa que la otra, oiga....
[#37](c37#c-37) dar una bofetada y amenazas es una agresion fisica, dar cuchillas es una agresion física e intento de asesinato.
Si mejor te vale. Las dos acciones son condenables e ilegales.
Ahora justificar lo que queráis
[#38](c38#c-38) Aquí nadie está justificando nada,no te confundas.
Pero amigo, al comparar ambos casos, ESTOS EN CONCRETO para llevar al "ascua a tu sardina ideológica", es de manipulación de libro.
Y sí, ambos delitos son punibles legalmente pero compararlos es una manipulación descarada, discúlpame que te lo señale.
[#39](c39#c-39) en el fondo son ambas agresiones porque no me gusta lo que dices.
Me encanta que quede la gente en ridículo y en la mas absoluta hipocresía
[#42](c42#c-42) Sin duda es bastante hipócrita y añado, muy manipulador, comparar ambos casos.
Un saludo y un autoabrazo, amigo.
[#44](c44#c-44) pues decir lo que quieras, en el fondo de las dos agresiones es el mismo punto de partida.
A un nazi y a un extremista religioso no le gustaban lo que decían otros.
Aquí, los extremos se tocan.
Perdón no había visto tu perfil hasta ahora, para la próxima vez ni me molesto en perder el tiempo en contestar.
[#33](c33#c-33) Hoy le da por dar 2 hostias y mañana ppr una paliza que te deja muerto.
Seguramente se contuvo al estar en medio de un local.
[#10](c10#c-10) Cierto, tanto el elefante como la hormiga entran en la especificación "reino animal".
PD: es "igualito" darle dos yoyas a un imbecil por bocazas que liarte a cuchilladas y herir a seis personas, con evidentes intenciones homicidas.
El "relativismo" que os gastáis algunos es vomitivo, discúlpame que te lo señale.
[#69](c69#c-69) equidistante en que son agresiones físicas porque no les gusta lo que dicen sus agresores.
Te molesta?
Ui perdón, no vi tu cuenta recién creada
[#6](c6#c-6) ¿Quien en concreto lo esta normalizando? Porque se esta persiguiendo a los autores, deteniendo y van a terminar encarcelados.
[#13](c13#c-13) ¿Entonces porque hablas en plural y en primera persona? ¿Formas parte del pequeño grupo de atacantes que ha acuchillado a gente?
[#17](c17#c-17) ¿Entonces afirmas que es "la sociedad Europea" la que lo esta normalizando y no "los atacantes" como decias en tu anterior comentario? Aclarate porque menudo veleteo manejas.
La "sociedad europea" considera esto delitos, persigue a sus autores y los encarcela. Asi que, obviamente, la "sociedad europea" no esta normalizando nada.
[#11](c11#c-11) yo en Twitter he visto a niñas secuestradas pro hamas donde les dicen que ya están en edad de ser violada y a gente aplaudiendo y diciendo que se jodan.
En la última noticia de Manheim había algunos justificando que se habrían sentido insultados, que uan manifestación así es como pedir que los maten... En Google está miralo tu.
[#15](c15#c-15) "habia algunos" esta a años luz de distancia de "estar normalizandolo".
Tambien "hay algunos" justificando ataques terroristas de todo tipo, robos, violaciones, etc; y eso no implica que lo "estemos normalizando" como dice el otro genio de la lampara.
[#24](c24#c-24) Que individuos justifiquen actividades delictivas no significa que como sociedad "lo estemos normalizando". No hay nada normal ni aceptado socialmente en acuchillar a gente. De hecho, quien lo hace termina encerrado en la carcel. De lo "normal" que es.
Es tan sencillo de entender que parece mentira que esteis aqui diciendo bobadas.
[#25](c25#c-25) en la última década he visto todo tipo de asesinatos y ataques por motivos islamistas. Luego si, esta normalizado pasivamente, a nadie le extraña esto ya, es cada poco tiempo.
Y en los últimos años he visto a gente justificar, para estos asesinar por el islam ya es una justificación por una ofensa que se debe pagar con la vis, estos lo han normalizado activamente.
Si, esta normalizado.
[#27](c27#c-27) estamos viendo ataques de fanáticos religiosos de todas las religiones. No pongas etiquetas a unos si y a otros no.
https://alfayomega.es/enorme-y-coordinado-ataque-fisico-a-cristianos-armenios-en-jerusalen/
[#30](c30#c-30) Vaya vaya.... ahora de golpe cambia la definicion de "normalizado" que tu mismo te habias inventado.
A ver si lo que quieres decir es otra cosa, pillin. Pero no te atreves a decirla en voz alta porque le tienes demasiado cariño a tus puntitos online.
[#36](c36#c-36) El genocidio rohinyá se refiere a la operación de limpieza étnica llevada a cabo por el ejército y la policía de Birmania, de mayoría budista, y por civiles budistas rakéin contra los musulmanes rohinyá en el estado de Rakáin, al noroeste del país. Los hechos incluyeron masacres, violaciones y la quema de las viviendas de los rohinyá.
[#41](c41#c-41) Yo entendí que descartaba las equivalencias entre religiones y vine a decir que todas las religiones quieren imponer sus leyes en todas partes y que cada cuál saque sus conclusiones.
[#2](c2#c-2) El único freno al islam en Europa es la ultra derecha. En España existe el Frente Obrero (y también tienen problemas) pero en otros países no, asi que eso es lo que vamos a ver.
Lo que me hace gracia es que la izquierda sólo se manifiesta contra la ultra-derecha, como si fuesen la mayor amenaza a nuestro modo de vida en los barrios obreros...
[#54](c54#c-54) La ultraderecha es la mayor amenaza para la sociedad e incluso para la supervivencia de la especie humana. Cada vez que se les ha dado chance lo han demostrado cometiendo genocidios, grandes guerras, afianzando dictaduras y llevando a cabo todo tipo de tropelías contra el pueblo. Parece mentira que la memoria sea tan corta.
[#54](c54#c-54) será por la experiencia de antaño, donde la extrema derecha suponía solo una panda de descerebrados, hasta que consiguieron el poder con sus artimañas.
[#54](c54#c-54), en Alemania también hay opciones de izquierda anti-islamistas.
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alianza_Sahra_Wagenknecht_-_Por_la_Raz%C3%B3n_y_la_Justicia
Yo quiero decir que ultraderecha o ultraizquierda o ultracentro, en Europa existe la libertad, la libertad de decir que algo no te gusta o que no te sientes seguro pensando que te pueden acuchillar fanáticos sectarios.
Y también existe la libertad para decir que no hay ningún peligro, que en Europa te vayan a acuchillar por la calle por motivos religiosos.
El punto es, que no estamos en países donde podemos pensar o decir se debe pagar con la muerte. Aquí gracias a la lucha de muchos no existe esa pena. Tampoco existen los castigos físicos como latigazos, las amputaciónes o la cárcel por ejercer libertad, tanto sexual, como religiosa.
Aquí puedes decir que yo no creo en esto y nadie te "mataba" o te mete en la cárcel.
[#50](c50#c-50) https://www.publico.es/sociedad/religion-aulas-catalunya-ofrece-clases-religion-islamica-reabre-viejo-debate.html
hay tienes a los culpables, la derecha no la izquierda
https://www.publico.es/espana/gobierno-da-carpetazo-ley-libertad.html#analytics-noticia:contenido-enlace
[#47](c47#c-47) no, los partidos laicos no han metido a la religion en la escuela, se llama leyes, si tienes religion cristiana en el colegio no puedes prohibir las otras.
¿Si el político es ultraderechista el agresor qué es? ¿Ultra-ultraderechista? Porque agredir entre 3 a un señor de 62 años de centros y de izquierdas no es.
[#7](c7#c-7) la perdición de la izquierda es pensar que el fanatismo religioso que ha luchado toda la vida contra la izquierda y pensamientos de izquierdas es una especie de colchón de votos contra la derecha Europa. Los marroquíes vinieron a España exclusivamente para matar comunistas, no había otra razón, no iban a dejar que el país de convirtiera en laico.
Ahora nosotros en agradecimiento les metemos el islam en nuestras escuelas y enseñamos árabe para que lo puedan entender. Bonita manera de cagarte en los republicanos asesinados por esta gente.
[#12](c12#c-12) sabes que el meter al islam en las escuelas es "culpa" de meter al cristianismo en las escuelas? si no quieres islam en las escuelas tienes que sacar a todas las religiones de las mismas.
[#12](c12#c-12) en este país quien ha masacrado a democratas ha sido el franquismo, adorado por la derecha.
A lo sumo, tenemos la guardia mora de Franco, arrasando a placer, si te refieres a esos marroquíes.

author: ossiedk
title: Falsely banned for account boosting and COOP wiped | Hypixel Forums
text: [ossiedk](/members/ossiedk.6858808/) New Member - Joined - Jul 5, 2024 - Messages - 1 - Reaction score - 0 Usually when I read these types of forum threads I dismiss them as someone just crying over getting caught, but please read our case carefully On the 10th of august my COOP player and irl friend made an auction for an Obsidian Chestplate starting at 50k or smth like that. He needed some quick money and put up some trash we had laying around, anyways, a couple of minutes later an random account called "kloddar" bits 400 million coins on the obsidian chestplate and we are lowkey freaking out knowing that this will look insanely suspicious, and therefore we decide to create a support ticket asking if we should be worrying or do anything (look images attached for the auction) We wait a couple of days without touching the money in the auction because we are obviously scared to get wiped since we know how it looks. Anyways, after 2 days time, we get an answer on out support ticket which is also attached below. As you can read from the answer, that the agent reassures us that if we haven't broken any rules, we shouldn't be scared, and breathe out heavily and we go on the spend the coins since we just got told we were fine. Fast forward to 3 days later, during a Cata M4 run we all get sent to limbo and the account that created the auction (1auge) gets a 90d ban smacked in his face for boosting and all of our coop profiles gets wiped. We obviously instantly believe this is the cause, and both submit and ban appeal which is denied by the appeal bot only after an hour or two. On top of that I also create a ticket on hypixel's support dashboard and it also gets ignored, being closed without even recieving and answer I also tried adding commenting on the original support ticket that the agent gave us an answer on, but we still haven't received an answer for that one either, and I'm very much looking forward to it also being shutdown as "solved" without getting an answer lol Another note to add to this, is that the account that was banned for alleged boosting (1auge) had around 2 billion coins in skins bought from Skyblock Gems and he was quite a spender on gems on the server, so why in heaven would he ever want to risk his account by buying coins from an external source when he has bought gems like 4 times at this point and has a huge networth lying around in skins, its not like he needed money. Anyways, I am lost at this point, idk what to do, the admins and support are ignoring us, are we just done? Did we just loose like 1500 hours of progress across 3 accounts and ~500$ of real world money spent on gems because some random decided to bit 400m on one of our auctions? How is that even fair? On the 10th of august my COOP player and irl friend made an auction for an Obsidian Chestplate starting at 50k or smth like that. He needed some quick money and put up some trash we had laying around, anyways, a couple of minutes later an random account called "kloddar" bits 400 million coins on the obsidian chestplate and we are lowkey freaking out knowing that this will look insanely suspicious, and therefore we decide to create a support ticket asking if we should be worrying or do anything (look images attached for the auction) As you can read from the answer, that the agent reassures us that if we haven't broken any rules, we shouldn't be scared, and breathe out heavily and we go on the spend the coins since we just got told we were fine. Fast forward to 3 days later, during a Cata M4 run we all get sent to limbo and the account that created the auction (1auge) gets a 90d ban smacked in his face for boosting and all of our coop profiles gets wiped. We obviously instantly believe this is the cause, and both submit and ban appeal which is denied by the appeal bot only after an hour or two. On top of that I also create a ticket on hypixel's support dashboard and it also gets ignored, being closed without even recieving and answer I also tried adding commenting on the original support ticket that the agent gave us an answer on, but we still haven't received an answer for that one either, and I'm very much looking forward to it also being shutdown as "solved" without getting an answer lol Another note to add to this, is that the account that was banned for alleged boosting (1auge) had around 2 billion coins in skins bought from Skyblock Gems and he was quite a spender on gems on the server, so why in heaven would he ever want to risk his account by buying coins from an external source when he has bought gems like 4 times at this point and has a huge networth lying around in skins, its not like he needed money. Anyways, I am lost at this point, idk what to do, the admins and support are ignoring us, are we just done? Did we just loose like 1500 hours of progress across 3 accounts and ~500$ of real world money spent on gems because some random decided to bit 400m on one of our auctions? How is that even fair?

author: Nate Lunak
title: VIDEO: Shocking New Footage Shows Controversial Gender Row Boxer Lin Yu-Ting Throwing A Dangerously Illegal Punch That Could Have Been Fatal
text: There’s been lots of drama surrounding the women’s [boxing](https://www.totalprosports.com/boxing/) portion of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, especially surrounding Taiwanese female boxer Lin Yu-Ting. Rumors of transgender athletes competing have been surrounding Algerian Imane Khelif and now Lin. This time, the headline doesn’t completely revolve around those rumors and what happened inside the ring. Lin caught major backlash for what she did to Turkish opponent Ezra Kahraman. As seen in the video, she was caught hitting Kahraman in the back of the head with what is called a rabbit punch, which is against the rules and could lead to fatal injuries. The fans, coaches, and commentators weren’t unafraid to voice their displeasure. “That was perilously close to being more than a ticking-off for me. That was quite a long time after the break and in full knowledge that her opponent had turned around, but Lin got away with that,” said the commentator. Also Read: [VIDEO: Social Media Is Fuming After Watching Transgender Boxer Ruthlessly Destroy Female Opponent At 2024 Paris Olympics](https://www.totalprosports.com/olympics/video-social-media-is-fuming-after-watching-transgender-boxer-ruthlessly-destroy-female-opponent-at-2024-paris-olympics/) Click on ‘Follow Us’ and get notified of the most viral Olympic Games Paris 2024 stories via Google! [Follow Us](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMLHdqwswrujDAw) Lin would go on to win the match 5-0 and only continued to ignite the controversy surrounding her ability to continue participating in the Olympics. Lin Yu-Ting and Imane Khelif Set To Compete For Gold Medal Possibly one of the most anticipated gold medal matches of the 2024 Olympics will be between Khelif and Lin in the [women’s 66kg bracket](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/bracket/boxing/women-s-66kg). It’s not necessarily because of support either, as both their names have been surrounded by controversy as to whether or not they should have been disqualified from the tournament due to being born with XY chromosomes. Last year, both were disqualified from the boxing World Championships for that reason. Still, the International Olympic Committee stands with both women and their ability to continue competing in the Olympic games. “These athletes have been competing in senior competitions for six years with no issues. These women were eligible for this contest, remain eligible for this contest, and compete in this contest,” said Mark Adams, spokesperson for the IOC. Also Read: [International Boxing Association Reveals Shocking Information About Controversial Olympic Boxers Imane Khelif and Lin Yu-ting](https://www.totalprosports.com/olympics/international-boxing-association-reveals-shocking-information-about-controversial-olympic-boxers-imane-khelif-and-lin-yu-ting/)
